title: Messages are not received in the encrypted community

labels.name: E:DCommunityBugFixesForMVP
labels.description: Misc bug fixes about communities that are due for the MVP

milestone.description:
Milestone cycles:

[Cycle 1](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A0.14+label%3AC1): 7 July
[Cycle 2](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A0.14+label%3AC2): 28 July 
[Cycle 3](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A0.14+label%3AC3): 18 August


**--- Main focus ---**

**1. Token permissions to enable control of community smart contracts**
- Before a community founder can use any of the community token admin functionality, they first have to deploy Owner and Token Master contracts.
- This work involves: new empty state screen for Mint and Airdrop tokens (before current empty state screen is revealed), new flow for deploying the community's Owner and Token Master contracts in a single step, a fixed uneditable permission giving anybody who holds the Token Master token admin rights for the community should be automatically created.
- Only the holder of the single Owner token can access the Token Master airdrop, remote destruct, and view holders functions. Anybody who holds the Token Master token can access all token admin options, excluding those related to the Token Master token itself, as well as being and Admin of the community.
- This will all be explained in more detail in the designs.

Backend Epic: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11249

**2. Update Community Admin home screen inc control node transfer and associated dialogues**
- Remove ability for a Owner to leave a community on the computer that's running as that community's control node
- Community Admin home screen cleanup (inc. adding at least one of the three graphs, whichever is easiest to implement).
  - Graph issue: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11152  
  - Community overview: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11278

**3. Ability for user to select & manage accounts shared with each community control node**
- This item is quite a bit of work
- Touches Community settings, as well as all of the community join flows
- Backend issues: 
  - Join API: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11154
  - Edit API: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11153

**4. Encryption for token gated channels that are inside Open (not token gated) communities**
[#10998](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10998)

**5. Final screens and bits and bobs needed prior to public beta**
- Modal that's shown every time after login, reminding user's that Status Desktop is in Beta [#11044](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11044)
- The bug with 'requests to join' a community not constantly arriving, or sometimes arriving after a delay, must be fixed. [#8264](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/8264)
- Anything that didn't get completed in 0.13 related to new share URL format
- All the outstanding bugs and small items that got pushed into the 0.14 milestone.


**--- Things that we SHOULD NOT work on during the 0.14 cycle ---**
- Messaging and UI teams shouldn't work on perf. in 0.14 (but Wallet team should!)
- Anything big mutual contacts related, other than fixing small bugs we find like #10497 #10498 #11120 #11121  (hopefully this functionality working good enough now!)

**--- Wallet Team ---**

1. Finish any outstanding work related to Activity screens (top priority - aim to have complete by July 14th)

2. Updated Wallet Settings screens UI inc. account syncing functionality  *Synced information should immediately be reflected in the UI after it is received (sometimes synced info is currently only displayed after the next app restart, this needs to be fixed)*

3. Wallet performance and memory consumption optimisations

4. Fix bugs, clean up loose ends (to get things in a good state before the work on the Mobile wallet starts)

body: # Bug Report edit: it turns out the issue is about not receiving messages. See comments below Messages sent by me are not getting delivered in status CC community channels. Direct messages sent to contacts seem to be working fine. ## Description I have recently installed Status Desktop on my macbook and joined the Status CC Community as i am a new joinee. I am seeing messages sent by others in the same community channel. Attaching screenshots of a channel seen by me and my colleague. Screenshot as seen in my app: Secreenshot as seen in my colleague's app: ![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/20137744/e4bbd595-fffa-41d9-8b42-6360b8035b54) As you can see, my colleague doesn't see the message sent by me, whereas it is shown in my view. Similarly he is not able to see the message sent by another person SidActual whereas i am able to see it. Similarly the intro message i have posted in intros channel also is not delivered, as my colleague is not able to see it. Looks like something has gone wrong wrt communities. I have even restarted the status app, but still noticing the same behaviour. ## Steps to reproduce Nothing specific, already highlighted in description. #### Expected behavior My messages should be sent to community channels once my request to join has been accepted. #### Actual behavior None of my messages are being sent out/delivered. ### Additional Information - Status desktop version: 0.12.0 - Operating System: MacOS 13.4 (22F66) on M2 MBP

Hi, I can see your message in the channel `#weeb-room`. I feel like you are having low peers. Can you activate the "Node management" setting in Profile > Advanced? 

Then, you'll have a new tab on the left called "Node Management". Check how many peers you have.

Actually, looking at the screenshots, I think it's your colleague that is having issues. Here is was I see:
![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/11926403/99fa2986-b23e-4146-a62c-d8a5847aff68)

Thansk @jrainville for quick response. 
 I have node management enabled, and i can see 9 peers. 
That is interesting, @richard-ramos is the colleague i was referring to.
Are you able to see my intro message in the intros channel?

> Are you able to see my intro message in the intros channel?

Yes

> That is interesting, @richard-ramos is the colleague i was referring to.

Did you open the same data dir mutliple times by any chance?

Ok.

Not sure what you mean by same data dir? Is it used by status desktop app for local storage?

> Not sure what you mean by same data dir? Is it used by status desktop app for local storage?

Sorry, that was a question for @richard-ramos . Basically, the app generate a data directory with a DB the first time you login. You can move that data directory somewhere else, but if you open it somewhere else and use it at the same time as the original copy, it can create issues with the encryption keys.
Hmm. i think i haven't? I'll try restoring my account from scratch

After restoring my account, I can only see my `test` message in #weeb-room: 
![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/1106587/df2a2818-7691-400c-9a2d-acc39373a35b)

I do see other messages from today in diff channels tho. Maybe the messages didn't arrive to the store node

Update:
Checking with @Jo, we see that the problem seems to happen only with the status community. Using a newer community works just fine.

The following log line was found:
```
246172c0951bdee0ca8ef1f402e5b90eeeb48d9539ec69886ecadb070cb1e81ccc7588a2b93968b172f832745ef5 my-installation-id=e4bd5c67-a327-40d6-9d63-1c1250ceeefc messageID=0x9fd32a77274bb210f9d2759ebeb1260a3ff16e09f5311467d592dc4170169f05
t=2023-06-21T14:40:31-0400 lvl=dbug msg="failed to handle an encryption message" site=handleMessages hash="[159 211 42 119 39 75 178 16 249 210 117 158 190 177 38 10 63 241 110 9 245 49 20 103 213 146 220 65 112 22 159 5]" error="failed to process an encrypted message: Hash ratchet group id not found"
```

@cammellos, I can reproduce this error consistently with the status community. 
How does this hash ratchet group id is created? for some reason i don't have it?

@richard-ramos the keys most likely haven't been propagated, how did you get access to the community?
@Samyoul has been working on something that should allev'iate the issue for a while as well, any update @Samyoul ?

> how did you get access to the community?

I restored my account using a seedphrase

> > how did you get access to the community?
> 
> I restored my account using a seedphrase

which version of desktop did you have before? the keys should be in the backup, but depends on which version of desktop you were running
I was using a ~1w old .AppImage built from `master`

> I was using a ~1w old .AppImage built from `master`

it should have definitely had the keys, I will take a look at it, some bug for sure

I took a closer look into the issue by comparing the `key_id`s from valid and invalid instances.
```
SELECT key_id, CAST(hex(group_id) AS TEXT) AS group_id
FROM hash_ratchet_encryption
```

For a valid instance (where the client can receive community messages):
```
3564023328 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3564023329 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3680164834 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3680164835 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3680164836 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3680164837 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3680164838 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
```

On the other hand, an invalid instance:
```
3564023328 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3564023329 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3680164834 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3680164835 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3680164836 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
3680164837 | 03073514D4C14A7D10AE9FC9B0F05ABC904D84166A6AC80ADD58BF6A3542A4E50A
```

The invalid instance is lacking the latest ratchet key with id 3680164838. **The question arises, why wasn't the newest ratchet key delivered to one of the clients?** This issue will be mitigated with: https://github.com/status-im/status-go/issues/3404

Side issues:
- key_id is wrong, it should be unix timestamp in ms, @Samyoul [spotted](https://github.com/status-im/status-go/issues/3675) it already
- 5 keys were created in a row (3680164834...3680164838), seems wrong, there might be a logic error in status-go when distributing new keys
I've linked a PR that should mitigate the issue. It accomplishes this through periodic rekeying, which is set to occur every hour by default.
